page.title: 08VIDEO DISCS 1 - BLACKBURN
page.content: When Mullard are making a Laser Vision Disc for a customer they first need a video tape from the customer containing all the material which is to be put on the video disc. The three main stages, all of which take place in Blackburn, in the making of a video disc are, 1. MASTERING 2. STAMPER MAKING 3. REPLICATION Making the master involves equipment whiosts over one million pounds. A Laser Beam Recorder transfers the pictures from the video tape into very minute holes on a glass plate. These holes are called PITS. The glass plate is then coated with silver to seal the pits. The master is then ready to be tested and used in the next stage of disc production.
